form.longName: PhenX PX140501 - Personal History Of Type 1 And Type 2 Diabetes
form.preferredDefinition: These interviewer-administered questions from the Multi-Ethnic Study of Arthrosclerosis (MESA) ascertain whether an individual has ever been told by a doctor or health care professional that he or she has diabetes.

module.longName: Personal History of Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes
module.preferredDefinition: Personal History of Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes

question.questionText: Has your doctor or health care professional told you that you had one of the following: Diabetes (sugar in blood) (diabetes)
IF YES: Are you taking medicine for this? (diabetes_medicine)
If Yes to are you taking medicine for diabetes: (diabetes_medicine_type)
IF YES: At what age was this first treated? (diabetes_age)
IF YES: At what age was this first treated? (diabetes_age_coded)
Was insulin your first diabetes medicine? (diabetes_insulin)
For Women: did diabetes occur ONLY during Pregnancy? (diabetes_women_pregnancy)

protocol.longName: Personal History of Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes
protocol.preferredDefinition: These interviewer-administered questions from the Multi-Ethnic Study of Arthrosclerosis (MESA) ascertain whether an individual has ever been told by a doctor or health care professional that he or she has diabetes.

form.longName: PhenX PX140601 - Personal History Of Kidney Failure
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes three interviewer-administered questions from the Strong Heart Study about kidney failure, renal dialysis, and kidney transplantation.

question.questionText: Has a medical person ever told you that you had kidney failure? (kidney_failure)
If YES to being told by a medical person that you have kidney failure, are one or both working well now? (kidneys_working_now)
How old were you when you were first told by a medical person that you had kidney failure? Indicate the actual age. (kidney_failure_age)
How old were you when you were first told by a medical person that you had kidney failure? Indicate the actual age. (kidney_failure_age_coded)
Are you currently on renal dialysis? (dialysis)
Have you ever had a kidney transplant? (kidney_transplant)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes three interviewer-administered questions from the Strong Heart Study about kidney failure, renal dialysis, and kidney transplantation.

form.preferredDefinition: The protocol includes three interviewer-administered questions from the Los Angeles Latino Eye Study (LALES) that capture whether a respondent has eye disease due to diabetes and whether the respondent has had laser treatment for retinopathy.

question.questionText: Has a medical doctor ever told you that diabetes has affected blood vessels in your eyes or that you had diabetic retinopathy or diabetic eye disease? (doctor_retinopathy)
Did you ever have laser treatment or surgery for your diabetic eye disease? (laser_treatment)
How many different times have you had laser treatment or surgery for diabetic eye disease? (laser_treatment_times)
How many different times have you had laser treatment or surgery for diabetic eye disease? (laser_treatment_times_coded)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The protocol includes three interviewer-administered questions from the Los Angeles Latino Eye Study (LALES) that capture whether a respondent has eye disease due to diabetes and whether the respondent has had laser treatment for retinopathy.

form.longName: PhenX PX140801 - Fasting Plasma Glucose For Diabetes Screening Blood Draw
form.preferredDefinition: Participants are asked to fast for at least 9 hours (generally overnight) prior to the fasting plasma glucose test. Participants are asked a series of exclusionary questions and then have blood drawn. The plasma is separated from the blood via centrifugation and glucose concentration is determined via a hexokinase-mediated reaction.

headerInstruction.text: The following is a summary version of the full National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey 20072008 protocol. The full National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey 20072008 Fasting Plasma Glucose Test Procedures are part of the Oral G..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Did you eat or drink anything other than plain water after [Insert time at 9 hours prior to sample collection] last night? (eat_or_drink)
When did you last eat or drink anything other than water? (last_eat_or_drink_date)
When did you last eat or drink anything other than plain? (last_eat_or_drink_time)
Have you had any of the following since {insert time from 1 here}? Coffee or tea with cream and sugar? [Include milk or nondairy creamers.] (coffee_tea)
If Yes, record time (coffee_tea_time)
If Yes, record date (coffee_tea_date)
Have you had any of the following since {insert time from 1 here}? Alcohol, such as beer, wine, or liquor? (alcohol)
If Yes, record time (alcohol_time)
If Yes, record date (alcohol_date)
Have you had any of the following since {insert time from 1 here}? Gum, breath mints, lozenges, or cough drops, or other cough or cold remedies? (gum)
If Yes, record time (gum_time)
If Yes, record date (gum_date)
Have you had any of the following since {insert time from 1 here}? Antacids, laxatives, or antidiarrheals? (antacids)
If Yes, record time (antacids_time)
If Yes, record date (antacids_date)
Have you had any of the following since {insert time from 1 here}? Dietary Supplements such as vitamins and minerals? [Include multivitamins and single nutrient supplements.] (dietary_supplements)
If Yes, record time (dietary_supplements_time)
If Yes, record date (dietary_supplements_date)
Are you currently pregnant? (pregnant)
{Is SP/Are you} now taking insulin? (taking_insulin)
{Is SP/Are you} now taking diabetic pills to lower {his/her}/your} blood sugar? These are sometimes called oral agents or oral hypoglycemic agents (diabetic_pills)
Do you have hemophilia? (exclusion from Phlebotomy) (hemophilia)
Have you received cancer chemotherapy in the past four weeks or do you anticipate such therapy in the next four weeks? (exclusion from Phlebotomy) (chemotherapy)
Exclusion Criteria (exclusion_criteria)

validValue.meaningText: Received cancer chemotherapy in the last 3 weeks
validValue.description: Received cancer chemotherapy in the last 3 weeks

validValue.meaningText: Has not fasted at least 9 hours.
validValue.description: Has not fasted at least 9 hours.

question.questionText: Was blood drawn? (blood_draw_done)
Was full sample obtained? (blood_draw_sample)
Record any comments about the blood draw, including any reasons for the tube not being drawn according to the protocol. (blood_draw_comments)
Record any comments about the sample during processing. (sample_comments)
Make of the equipment used to perform the hexokinasemediated reaction. (equipment_make)
Manufacturer of the equipment used to perform the hexokinasemediated reaction. (equipment_manufacturer)
Repeatability of the assay (assay_repeatability)
Coefficient of variation for the assay (coefficient_of_variation)
Glucose concentration (glucose_concentration)
Was the participant fasting? (fasting_or_casual_glucose_concentration)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Participants are asked to fast for at least 9 hours (generally overnight) prior to the fasting plasma glucose test. Participants are asked a series of exclusionary questions and then have blood drawn. The plasma is separated from the blood via centrifugation and glucose concentration is determined via a hexokinase-mediated reaction.

form.longName: PhenX PX140802 - Fasting Plasma Glucose For Diabetes Screening Glucomet
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol provides basic information for measuring blood glucose concentrations using a glucose meter or glucometer. Participants are asked to fast for at least 9 hours (generally overnight) prior to the test.

headerInstruction.text: Description of Protocol This protocol provides basic information for measuring blood glucose concentrations using a glucose meter or glucometer. Participants are asked to fast for at least 9 hours (generally overnight) prior to the test.

question.questionText: Specific Instructions If the 9hour fast is not met, the Diabetes Working Group recommends that the test can still be completed as a "casual" glucose concentration (see protocol for casual glucose reference ranges for screening plus/minus Diabetes). SP=Sample Person (pxt140802_instructions)
Enter in time 9 hours prior to sample collection: (pxt140802_ninehours_prior)
Did you eat or drink anything other than plain water after [pxt140802_ninehours_prior] last night? (pxt140802_eat_or_drink)
When did you last eat or drink anything other than plain water? (pxt140802_last_eat_or_drink_time)
When did you last eat or drink anything other than plain water? (pxt140802_last_eat_or_drink_date)
Have you had any of the following since [pxt140802_ninehours_prior]? Coffee or tea with cream and sugar? [Include milk or nondairy creamers.] (pxt140802_coffee_tea)
If Yes, record time (pxt140802_coffee_tea_time)
If Yes, record Date (pxt140802_coffee_tea_date)
Have you had any of the following since [pxt140802_ninehours_prior]? Alcohol, such as beer, wine, or liquor? (pxt140802_alcohol)
If Yes, record time (pxt140802_alcohol_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt140802_alcohol_date)
Have you had any of the following since [pxt140802_ninehours_prior]? Gum, breath mints, lozenges, or cough drops, or other cough or cold remedies? (pxt140802_gum)
If Yes, record time (pxt140802_gum_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt140802_gum_date)
Have you had any of the following since [pxt140802_ninehours_prior]? Antacids, laxatives, or antidiarrheals? (pxt140802_antacids)
If Yes, record time (pxt140802_antacids_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt140802_antacids_date)

Have you had any of the following since [pxt140802_ninehours_prior]? Dietary Supplements such as vitamins and minerals? [Include multivitamins and single nutrient supplements.] (pxt140802_dietary_supplements)
If Yes, record time (pxt140802_dietary_supplements_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt140802_dietary_supplements_date)
Are you currently pregnant? (pxt140802_pregnant)
{Is SP/Are you} now taking insulin? (pxt140802_taking_insulin)
{Is SP/Are you} now taking diabetic pills to lower {his/her}/your} blood sugar? These are sometimes called oral agents or oral hypoglycemic agents (pxt140802_diabetic_pills)
Do you have hemophilia? (exclusion from Phlebotomy) (pxt140802_hemophilia)
Have you received cancer chemotherapy in the past four weeks or do you anticipate such therapy in the next four weeks? (exclusion from Phlebotomy) (pxt140802_chemotherapy)
Exclusion Criteria (pxt140802_exclusion_criteria)

Repeatability of the assay (pxt140802_assay_repeatability)

Glucose concentration (pxt140802_glucose_concentration)

form.longName: PhenX PX140901 - Glycosylated Hemoglobin Assay That Reflects Longterm Gl
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol provides instructions for drawing, processing, and storing blood for the hemoglobin A1c assay according to the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) methods. Toolkit users are referred to the National Glycohemoglobin Standardization Program (NGSP) for standardized laboratory assays.

form.longName: PhenX PX141001 - Oral Glucose Tolerance Test
form.preferredDefinition: Participants are asked to fast for at least 9 hours (generally overnight) prior to the Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT). Participants are asked a series of exclusionary questions and then have an initial blood draw to determine Fasting Plasma Glucose levels. Participants are next asked to drink a calibrated dose (generally 75 grams/10 ounces) of a dextrose solution (e.g., Trutol) and have a second venipuncture 2 hours (plus or minus 15 minutes) after the first venipuncture. The plasma is separated from the blood via centrifugation, and glucose concentration is determined via the hexokinase method.

headerInstruction.text: The following is a summary version of the full National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey 20072008 protocol. The full National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey 20072008 Oral Glucose Tolerance Test Procedures can be found here: 2..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Exclusion Criteria: Persons will be excluded from this component if they: Report that they are taking oral medications for diabetes Report that they are taking insulin Report that they are pregnant Report that they have hemophilia Report that they have received cancer chemotherapy in the last 3 weeks and Report that they have not fasted at least 9 hours. SP= Sample Person. (pxt141001_ninehours_prior)
Did you eat or drink anything other than plain water after 9 hours prior to sample collection last night? (pxt141001_eat_or_drink)

If answer is "No" then he or she has met the 9hour fast. If answer is "Yes", "Don't know", or "Refused", then the actual fasting time is unknown. The SP is excluded from the Oral Glucose Tolerance test if the 9hour fast is not met and will not be met with 1 hour and 40 minutes left in the session. (if_answer_is_no_then_he_or)
Confirmation Question: (confirmation_question)
When did you last eat or drink anything other than plain water? (pxt141001_last_eat_or_drink_time)
When did you last eat or drink anything other than plain water? (pxt141001_last_eat_or_drink_date)
Have you had any of the following since 9 hours prior to sample collection? Coffee or tea with cream and sugar? [Include milk or nondairy creamers.] (pxt141001_coffee_tea)
If Yes, record time (pxt141001_coffee_tea_time)
If Yes, record Date (pxt141001_coffee_tea_date)
Have you had any of the following since 9 hours prior to sample collection? Alcohol, such as beer, wine, or liquor? (pxt141001_alcohol)
If Yes, record time (pxt141001_alcohol_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt141001_alcohol_date)
Have you had any of the following since 9 hours prior to sample collection? Gum, breath mints, lozenges, or cough drops, or other cough or cold remedies? (pxt141001_gum)
If Yes, record time (pxt141001_gum_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt141001_gum_date)
Have you had any of the following since 9 hours prior to sample collection? Antacids, laxatives, or antidiarrheals? (pxt141001_antacids)
If Yes, record time (pxt141001_antacids_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt141001_antacids_date)

Have you had any of the following since 9 hours prior to sample collection? Dietary Supplements such as vitamins and minerals? [Include multivitamins and single nutrient supplements.] (pxt141001_dietary_supplements)
If Yes, record time (pxt141001_dietary_supplements_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt141001_dietary_supplements_date)
Are you currently pregnant? (pxt141001_pregnant)
{Is SP/Are you} now taking insulin? (pxt141001_taking_insulin)
{Is SP/Are you} now taking diabetic pills to lower {his/her}/your} blood sugar? These are sometimes called oral agents or oral hypoglycemic agents (pxt141001_diabetic_pills)
Do you have hemophilia? (exclusion from Phlebotomy) (pxt141001_hemophilia)
Have you received cancer chemotherapy in the past four weeks or do you anticipate such therapy in the next four weeks? (exclusion from Phlebotomy) (pxt141001_chemotherapy)
Exclusion Criteria (pxt141001_exclusion_criteria)

validValue.meaningText: Received cancer chemotherapy in the last 3 weeks
validValue.description: Received cancer chemotherapy in the last 3 weeks

validValue.meaningText: Has not fasted at least 9 hours.
validValue.description: Has not fasted at least 9 hours.

question.questionText: Was blood drawn? (blood_draw_1_done)
Was full sample obtained? (blood_draw_1_sample)
Record any comments about the blood draw, including any reasons for the tube not being drawn according to the protocol. (first_blood_draw_comments)
Record the weight of the participant (weight)
Weight recorded in lbs or kg (weight_units)
Record the amount of dextrose solution administered (amount_of_dextorse_solution)
Record the units of the amount of dextrose solution administered (amount_of_dextorse_solution_units)
Record the amount of dextrose solution the participant drank (amount_of_dextorse_solution_consumed)
Record whether all of the solution was consumed in 10 minutes (dextorse_solution_consumed_10minutes)

validValue.meaningText: No - Solution not consumed in 10 minutes
validValue.description: No - Solution not consumed in 10 minutes

question.questionText: Record the number of minutes elapsed between consuming dextrose solution and administering the second blood draw (minutes_between_dextrose_blooddraw)
Was blood drawn? (blood_draw_2_done)
Was full sample obtained? (blood_draw_2_sample)
Record any comments about the blood draw, including any reasons for the tube not being drawn according to the protocol. (second_blood_draw_comments)
Repeatability of the assay (pxt141001_assay_repeatability)
Coefficient of variation for the assay (pxt141001_coefficient_of_variation)
Fasting glucose concentration (fasting_glucose_concentration)
OGTT glucose concentration (ogtt_glucose_concentration)
Comments to describe the plasma from the first blood draw (plasma_comments_first_blood_draw)
Comments to describe the plasma from the second blood draw (plasma_comments_second_blood_draw)
Make and manufacturer of the equipment used to perform the hexokinasemediated reaction. (pxt141001_equipment_make_manufacturer)

First Venipuncture A fasting glucose blood test is performed on all participants 12 years and older who are examined in the morning session after a 9hour fast. Note from the Diabetes Working Group: Blood should be collected in an appropriate 10mL EDTA tube. Invert the tube 3 to 4 times to mix, store on ice and centrifuge within 30 minutes. Processing should yield ~ 4.5 mL of plasma which can then be separated into several 0.5 mL aliquots for multiple different tests. Venipuncture should generally be performed using the median cubital, cephalic, or basilic veins in the left arm unless this arm is unsuitable. If the veins in the left arm are unsuitable, look for suitable veins on the right arm. If the veins in the antecubital space on both arms are not suitable, then look for veins in the forearm or dorsal side of the hand on the left arm/hand and then the right arm/hand. Editor's Note: Please review chapter 4 of the Laboratory Procedures Manual from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey for a full description of Phlebotomy procedures. 20072008 NHANES Lab Manual. Recording the Results of the Venipuncture Procedure Immediately after completing the venipuncture, record the results of the blood draw, the reasons for a tube not being drawn according to the protocol, and any comments about the venipuncture. Note from the Diabetes Working Group: The Diabetes Working Group recommends that the investigator record whether the blood was drawn and whether the full amount was obtained. Administering the Trutol (Dextrose Solution) SPs who weigh more than 100 pounds will drink 10 ounces of Trutol. SPs who weigh less than 94 pounds must have a calibrated dose of Trutol. (first_venipuncture_a_fasti)
tabletrutol (tabletrutol)

Note: The investigator should record the calibrated amount of Trutol given to the sample person. Ask the SP to indicate a preference for one of the three flavors. Choose the flavor that matches the preference of the soft drink flavor that he or she prefers. Follow the instructions remove the correct amount of Trutol from the bottle before handing the bottle to the SP. Use a small medicine cup to measure the correct amount to remove and discard the excess Trutol. Hand the SP a cold bottle of Trutol (containing the calibrated dose) and a straw. SPs MUST consume the entire calibrated dose of the Trutol within 10 minutes. Recite the script "Please drink this solution within 10 minutes" and start the timer. The timer counts down from 10:00 minutes. When the SP has finished drinking the entire calibrated dose of Trutol, or cannot continue drinking the Trutol, then stop the timer. The choices for the amount of solution that the SP consumed are "All," "Some," or "None." Record the amount of solution the SP drank. If the SP drank "some" or "none" of the Trutol solution, then the section status is Not Done. If the total time is 00:10:00, then "Solution not consumed in 10 minutes." (note_the_investigator_shou)

Second Venipuncture If an SP consumed the entire calibrated dose of the Trutol solution in 10 minutes, then he or she is eligible to have a 2-ml gray top tube drawn 2 hours, -20 or +15 minutes, after he or she finished consuming the Trutol. (He or she must maintain the fast until the second blood draw is completed.) Editor's Note: Please review chapter 4 of the Laboratory Procedures Manual from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey for a full description of Phlebotomy procedures. "https://www.phenxtoolkit.org/toolkit_content/supplemental_info/diabetes/additional_info/NHANES_Lab_Manual.pdf" 2007-2008 NHANES Lab Manual. Immediately after completing the venipuncture, record the results of the blood draw, the reasons for a tube not being drawn according to the protocol, and any comments about the venipuncture. Note from the Diabetes Working Group: The Diabetes Working Group recommends that the investigator record whether the blood was drawn and whether the full amount was obtained. Process the Samples for the Plasma Glucose TestEditor's Note: Please review chapter 8 of the Laboratory Procedures Manual from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey 2007-2008 for a full description of Blood Processing procedures. "https://www.phenxtoolkit.org/toolkit_content/supplemental_info/diabetes/additional_info/NHANES_Lab_Manual.pdf" 2007-2008 NHANES Lab Manual.Centrifuge and separate the plasma from the tube as soon as possible. Process the specimen even if the contents of the gray tube clot. -Separate the plasma by centrifugation. -Use a calibrated plastic transfer pipette to transfer at least 0.5 mL plasma. -Determine if the plasma is hemolyzed, turbid, lipemic, or icteric. If so, enter a comment to describe the plasma. -Close all vessels secured to prevent leakage and evaporation. Note from the Diabetes Working Group: Plasma should be stored at -80C unti..TRUNCATED(second_venipuncture_if_an)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Participants are asked to fast for at least 9 hours (generally overnight) prior to the Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT). Participants are asked a series of exclusionary questions and then have an initial blood draw to determine Fasting Plasma Glucose levels. Participants are next asked to drink a calibrated dose (generally 75 grams/10 ounces) of a dextrose solution (e.g., Trutol) and have a second venipuncture 2 hours (plus or minus 15 minutes) after the first venipuncture. The plasma is separated from the blood via centrifugation, and glucose concentration is determined via the hexokinase method.

form.longName: PhenX PX141201 - Fasting Cpeptide Assay For Residual Beta Cell Function
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol provides instructions for drawing, processing, and storing blood according to the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) methods. As there are no standard assays for Cpeptide, the protocol also provides basic guidelines to aid comparability among different studies.

If Yes, record time (pxt141301_gum_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt141301_gum_date)
Have you had any of the following since [pxt141301_ninehours_prior]? Antacids, laxatives, or antidiarrheals? (pxt141301_antacids)
If Yes, record time (pxt141301_antacids_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt141301_antacids_date)

Have you had any of the following since [pxt141301_ninehours_prior]? Dietary Supplements such as vitamins and minerals? [Include multivitamins and single nutrient supplements.] (pxt141301_dietary_supplements)
If Yes, record time (pxt141301_dietary_supplements_time)
If Yes, record date (pxt141301_dietary_supplements_date)
Do you have hemophilia? (exclusion from Phlebotomy) (pxt141301_hemophilia)
Have you received cancer chemotherapy in the past four weeks or do you anticipate such therapy in the next four weeks? (exclusion from Phlebotomy) (pxt141301_chemotherapy)
Was blood drawn? (pxt141301_blood_draw_done)
Was full sample obtained? (pxt141301_blood_draw_sample)
Record any comments about the blood draw, including any reasons for the tube not being drawn according to the protocol. (pxt141301_blood_draw_comments)
Record any comments about the sample during processing. (pxt141301_sample_comments)
Type of assay performed to determine the concentration of Insulin (pxt141301_assay_type)
Make and manufacturer of the equipment used (pxt141301_equipment_make_manufacturer)
Repeatability of the assay (pxt141301_assay_repeatability)
Coefficient of variation for the assay (pxt141301_coefficient_of_variation)
Insulin concentration (insulin_concentration)
Was the participant fasting? (fasting_or_casual_insulin_concentration)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol provides instructions for drawing, processing and storing blood according to the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) methods. As there are no standard assays for insulin, the protocol also provides basic guidelines to aid comparability among different studies.

form.longName: PhenX PX141401 - Serum Creatinine Assay For Kidney Function
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol provides instructions for drawing, processing, and storing blood for the serum creatinine assay according to the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) methods. Creatinine concentration in a participant's serum is measured according to the Jaffe rate method.

question.questionText: Do you have hemophilia? (pxt141401_hemophilia)
Have you received cancer chemotherapy in the past four weeks or do you anticipate such therapy in the next four weeks? (pxt141401_chemotherapy)

validValue.meaningText: Received cancer chemotherapy in the last 3 weeks
validValue.description: Received cancer chemotherapy in the last 3 weeks

Creatinine concentration in a participant's serum is measured according to the Jaffe rate method.
